data.title: Z Databases
data.text:
The most frequently-used databases

Academic OneFile This link opens in a new window

Featured

Extensive coverage of the physical sciences, technology, medicine, social sciences, the arts, theology, literature and other subjects.

Indexes more than 13,000 titles, including more than 7,300 peer-reviewed journals and more than 5,000 in full text peer-reviewed publications. Millions of articles available in both PDF and HTML full-text format. Also includes thousands of podcasts and transcripts from NPR, CNN and CBC as well as links to hundreds of medical videos from OR-Live.

Academic Search Complete This link opens in a new window

Featured

A comprehensive scholarly, multi-disciplinary database, with more than 6,500 full-text periodicals, including more than 6,000 peer-reviewed journals.

In addition to full text, this database offers indexing and abstracts for more than 10,000 journals.

Academic Video Online (AVON Alexander Street) This link opens in a new window

Featured

Academic Video Online (AVON) is a collection of 70,000 videos covering all academic interests. Videos are fully transcribed and indexed. Users can create & share playlists, video clips, and embed content in Blackboard.

Popular Channels Include:

1. Film Platform

2. American History

3. Anthropology

4. BBC Landmark

5. Black Studies

6. CNN

7. Counseling and Therapy

8. Documentaries

9. Music and Performing Arts

10. PBS

11. Science and Engineering

12. SONY Pictures Classics

Format: Streaming Videos

Ebook Central This link opens in a new window

Featured

Contains a collection of more than 200,000 titles from leading academic, scientific, technical, medical, and professional publishers. â€‹

To learn more about reading and borrowing on the EBook Central platform, go to https://proquest.libguides.com/ebookcentral

EBSCO Ebook Collection This link opens in a new window

Featured

Over 200,000 ebooks in a broad variety of academic disciplines.

JSTOR This link opens in a new window

Featured

JSTOR is a database of journals and primary sources that offers full-text to more than 2,300 journals.

Search and browse JSTOR citations from a mobile device.

To find out more about mobile apps, visit our Mobile Resources page.

Opposing Viewpoints In Context This link opens in a new window

Featured

Reviews today's hottest social issues, from capital punishment to immigration to marijuana. This cross-curricular resource supports science, social current events, and language arts classes.

PsycINFO This link opens in a new window

Featured

Psychology, psychiatry, and related disciplines, covering nearly 2000 journals. Includes everything found in the PsycARTICLES full-text database. Most of the publications covered are scholarly / peer-reviewed.

Sage Journals This link opens in a new window

Featured

The Sage Premiere package includes access to over 570 journals covering all disciplines.

ScienceDirect This link opens in a new window

Featured

ScienceDirect is a database of materials published by Elsevier and its affiliates, consisting of over 1800 journal and book titles. The overall focus is on science and engineering with some some social sciences and humanities titles covered as well.

SPIE Digital Library This link opens in a new window

Featured

Alternate Name(s) The International Society for Optics and Photonics

Search the leading research in optics and photonics applied research from SPIE journals, conference proceedings and presentations, and eBooks.

SpringerLink This link opens in a new window

Featured

Provides indexing and abstracting to over 2,500 scholarly journals . Full text is available for 300 journals and 100,000 ebooks. The database covers all areas of study, but is weighted toward the sciences.

A SpringerLink mobile app for iPhone is available in the iTunes App Store. iTunes App Store.

To find out more about mobile apps, visit our Mobile Resources page.

Web of Science This link opens in a new window

Featured

A bibliographic database of scholarly articles from 22,000 peer-reviewed journals worldwide. The platform provides tools for advanced search, citation analysis and bibliometrics.
